Mix 1 part wild west trading town with equal parts inventors, creators, and crazies, and Welcome to Rangston!

The Golden Bandit and his riff-raff are at it again! One year ago, they stole the face off the town’s clocktower, and now he‘s announced that he’s going to steal the whole thing. The automaton sheriff and his deputies need help (a bit desperately, I might add), and only the adventurers are around to lend aid!

The Golden Bandit is an adventure set in Tephra: the Steampunk RPG. It includes a slew of fully-statted opponents, traps, and mayhem just waiting to get in the adventurers’ way. This adventure includes maps, story hooks, and more to get your game going fast!

This book also welcomes you to Rangston, a wild west town that’s gone off the deep end. Inventors have flocked to this town, a town nestled at the remote intersection of several rail lines. You’ll get an introduction to Rangston, some great plot hooks, background stories, and even a new craft: Widgets! When trinkets are too small but you don’t want to make something crazy, widgets are perfect for you. And let’s not forget about Misery’s Mortuary: a prison for people who just can’t quite stay dead.

177217.name: Twisted Crossing
177217.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 250th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a bridge with twisting pillars across a river of molten rock.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

177218.name: White Mage
177218.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blend the power of life with the arcane!

With the new white mage class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, you can add arcane healers to about any OSR game. Unlike their fellow magic-users, they have chosen to learn restoration magic at a cost of delaying their offensive magic. Originally appearing on my old blog, this class has been updated and expanded to include conversion details for Labyrinth Lord.

177219.name: Black Mage
177219.description:
From publisher blurb:

Destroy your enemies with the power of black magic!

With the new black mage class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, you can add arcane destroyers to about any OSR game. Unlike their fellow magic-users, they have mastered the art of elemental attack spells, even learning to use some as innate powers instead of simply spells. Originally appearing on my old blog, this class has been updated and expanded to include conversion details for Labyrinth Lord.

In addition, there are three new spells for Adventurer Conqueror King, and seven new spells for Labyrinth Lord (though obviously there can be some cross over there as well!)

177220.name: OneDice Urban Fantasy
177220.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and easy urban fantasy role-playing rules

OneDice Urban Fantasy is a game of hidden magic in a fictionalised version of our world, where the enchantment of the Otherworlds spills over into mundane reality. The action takes place in the present day, in a fae-haunted city near you. Whether you want to play a Rosicrucian occultist, a werewolf detective, or a fae-blooded rock star, all the rules you need are in this book.

There are additional “skins” for adding other urban fantasy genres – the magic school, the modern world with magic everywhere, and a world with magic but no fae. Now get ready to rumble – the Unseelie Court have made a pact with the Twilight Brotherhood and there’s trouble brewing at the Goblin Market!

rpgseries: Far Away Land RPG Adventure Module
177221.name: Temple of Zoko
177221.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take a rowdy ride down a mysterious river as you search for the temple of the demon Zoko. Face river pirate elves, a cyclops guarding a mythical blade, angry squarks in cliff face caves, goabs, lake phantoms, and finally, denizens of the Abyssmalsphere. Will you survive this perilous quest or become demon fodder?

177222.description:
Description from the publisher:

Recreate the Battle of St. Mere Eglise with the new scenario expansion Heroes of Normandie: Sainte-Mere Eglise! This expansion features:


New special abilities: Charge, Urban Combatant, Demolition, Inspiration, Munitions Transport
New components: Camo, Cricket Lane, Gliders, Hawkins Mines, Knives
New character traits: Dropped (for paratroopers!), Sprinter, Walking Fire
177222.name: Heroes of Normandie: Sainte-Mere Eglise

177224.name: Dragon War: Riders of Ashara
177224.description:
Dragon War: Riders of Ashara is a table-top miniatures game of riders and their dragon steeds. Set in an original world drawing upon dragon mythology from the many legends of our own world, Dragon War: Riders of Ashara focuses on dragons and riders fighting against air, ground and sea adversaries. Their foes come from the nine kingdoms of man across three separate continents- each with their own motivations and machinations. Ashara is a world of incredibly high mountain ranges that divide the continents, meaning that wars must be fought either from the air or by sea.

Ashara, being the known lands of the kingdoms of mankind is at war. The year is 1448, being the 120th occurrence of the year of the Falcon in the Zodiac of Shen. Nations battle for conquest, glory, and power. Dragon riders, highly trained warriors and the pride of their nations, sit atop powerful dragons to do battle with one another and defend against threats from the skies, lands and seas of Ashara. Dragons fight with tooth, claws and their mighty breath weapons of fire, ice, lightning, poison, acid, wind or the mysterious life stealing power of the rend. Choose your dragon and the nation you defend as you take to the skies from the back of a young and agile drake or an ancient and powerful wyrm. Or, choose to register as one of the many mercenary wings, small bands of dragon riders fighting for the highest bidder or for your own personal crusade. The time has come for heroes and their mighty steeds to take to the skies. This is the age of the Riders of Ashara.

177225.description:
Publisher's summary:
憑者 (Tsukimono) is a Japanese boardgame from the doujin circle Illgang.

Get 3 YO-RIKI by attaching YO-KAI to the other players, and reach the mysterious mountain first.

集めた妖怪を他のプレイヤーにとり憑かせ、先に妖力３つを手にして妖山にたどりつくことを目指す、危険な遊戯です。
177225.name: Tsukimono

177226.name: Mythic Desert and Ocean Giants
177226.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masters of Dune and Wave!

It is said that the desert and the ocean have much in common, with the rolling dunes of sand often being compared to the rolling waves of the sea. Both are inhospitable places where food and water are scarce. Both are often home to valuable trade routes, and connect important mercantile cities. Both feature vast expanses of empty wasteland, dotted with hidden treasures, and both are the homes of unusual and exotic giant races.

This book presents game statistics for the mythic desert giant and mythic ocean giant, both of which have unique abilities never seen elsewhere. Mythic desert giants (CR 14) can glide across the dunes as easily as if they were ice, can conjure sandstorms from thin air, and can bring their scimitars to life, flying through the air to fight on their own. Their counterparts, the mythic ocean giants (CR 17), can command the creatures of the seas, create great vortices, and even transform themselves into pure ocean water.

177227.name: Down to Earth
177227.description:
From publisher blurb:

The firm base of pony society, the earth-bound are often overlooked, but are instrumental to their people and a solid addition to any adventuring party. Learn more of their ways for your Ponyfinder game.

New feats, equipment, spells and more all designed for earth-bound ponies!

177228.name: Unitron
177228.description:
From publisher blurb:

UNITRON!!

Wanting nothing less than to purge the planet of all organic life, Unitron has emerged and is ready to face your heroes. But are they ready to battle him? This issue details the history of the mechanical mastermind, but also gives past and current stats for his different incarnations, as well as his minions and bases! Can your heroes stop him or will they be fodder under his feet?

177229.name: Minutes
videogameversion: PSN Playstation 4 / Playstation Vita Downloadable edition
177229.description:
A unique slice of abstract action and gameplay purity. Collect, dodge, expand and squeeze your way across 60 intense levels. Can you achieve the tricky “Perfect” on them all?

Source: Game Website.

177230.name: Goldenrod Guides: A Guide to Swords & Wizardry Combat
177230.description:
From publisher blurb:

Goldenrod Guides are intended to be a toolbox of variant rules and ideas for you to use in your Swords & Wizardry game! This book focuses on various options related to combat, such as using weapon proficiencies and combat styles, as well as introducing rules for running jousts and other competitive tournaments.

177231.name: PDS 1
177231.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE Super gentlemans and womens magazine of Super Humans of days gone past. In each issue you get 10 amazing superhumans from the Public Domain brought to life in the Icons system.

In this issue you get Captain Flag, Black Owl, Diana, Cobra Queen, Blue Bolt, Blimpy, Miss Fury, Era, Flame Dame, and Checker.

177232.name: Campaigns in Cairnvarthi
177232.description:
From publisher blurb:

The disc planet Cairnvarthi: It was forged by the gods, and is under constant threat from Orcus and The Thrir. Do you have what it takes to withstand those forces of Chaos? Those who do have much glory and treasure to claim! Drawing inspiration from Norse, German, and Celtic culture, Cairnvarthi offers somewhere fantastic and new yet comfortably familiar for you to adventure in.

This book is split into two main sections. In the first you will learn about the realm, its history and people, its gods and demons, and everything else you need to know to become familiar enough with the setting to set your players loose in it once they have played through the second part, which is a campaign that takes new first-level characters up to fifth level!

Other features include:

A race of goblinoid henchmen for characters to use, known as Gooblitts.
A rat-like race of monster, known as the Ratten.
A system of magic for servants of Chaos to use (as found in ME503).
Random encounter tables for different terrain types for each of the Three Kingdoms.
Information about groups of note that characters can interact with.
Roughly 200 NPCs with stats and descriptions along with space to add your own notes about them as they appear in your game.

177233.name: Masks
177233.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masks is a mash-up game that takes a well known out-of-print super-hero game and a more modern super-hero game and blends them together the rules for the two games together, using the best elements of each system. For legal reasons, neither of the games can be named anywhere within this site or within Masks itself. However, this doesn't matter. If you know the games then you will pretty much instantly recognise them, and if you don't know the games then it doesn't matter - you can play Masks on its own merits.

Masks covers all types of hero from the lowest powered street-hero to the most powerful cosmic entity, and its mechanics (the "CHASING" system) can also be used for playing in other RPG genres.

Character sheets for Masks are included in the book itself, and can be easily printed from the PDF.

177234.name: FASERIP
177234.description:
From publisher blurb:

FASERIP is a retro-clone that emulates an old out-of-print super hero role-playing game. For legal reasons, the game that it emulates can't be named anywhere within this site or within FASERIP itself. However, this doesn't matter. If you know the game then you will pretty much instantly recognise it, and if you don't know the game then you can play FASERIP on its own merits.

FASERIP covers all types of hero from the lowest powered street-hero to the most powerful cosmic entity, and its mechanics can also be used for playing in other RPG genres, with four example alternate settings included within the book.

Character sheets for FASERIP are included in the book itself, and can be easily printed from the PDF.

177235.description:
It is the little tiger's birthday and he celebrates a real Tiger Party. All are invited: the fox, the lucky mole, the elegant goose and all the other Tiger Friends. Each brings paintings. The little tiger is highly excited because homemade gifts are the best, right? Splendid images for a terrific card game are a wonderful birthday gift and you can try it: View the pictures carefully and cleverly put cards and win real Tiger!

Game has 32 cards, and tiger points. Everyone gets 6 card and some tiger points. Each card has two or more tiger friends on it. On its turn player must play a card that don't have tiger friends that are on a card that is on a table, or draw a new card. Whoever plays his last card wins the round and gets tiger points from other players depending on how many tiger friends they have in hand.
When someone can't pay a game ends, and whoever has most tiger points is a winner.
177235.name: Janosch Tiger Party

177236.name: Enascentia
177236.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enascentia è il primo mondo selvaggio tutto italiano per Savage Worlds, firmato da Edoardo Dalla Via. Un regno fantastico e surreale, barocco e soprannaturale, dove hanno luogo imprese mozzafiato e strepitose.

Entra in Enascentia, scegli una delle Dieci Tribù, scopri il tuo Kami, sconfiggi i tuoi nemici, scopri il segreto che si nasconde dietro la tua creazione. Dopo di Enascentia, nulla sarà mai più lo stesso.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Enascentia is the first all-Italian wild world for Savage Worlds, signed by Edoardo Dalla Via. A fantasy realm and surreal, baroque and supernatural, where major companies breathtaking and amazing.

Log in Enascentia, choose one of the Ten Tribes, discover your Kami, defeat your enemies, discover the secret that hides behind your creation. After Enascentia, nothing will ever be the same.

177237.name: Freak Control
177237.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sono i fluorescenti anni Ottanta e la nascita della prima TV musicale, il boom dei personal computer e le pettinature cotonate convivono con un clima di forti tensioni politiche. Così quando il volo 747 della British Airways, partito da Londra e diretto a Boston, scompare dai radar durante la fase di atterraggio al Logan International Airport tutti pensano ad un attacco terroristico. Invece, dopo poco più di un minuto, l’aereo ricompare e si schianta senza controllo sulla pista. Nell’impatto perdono la vita una trentina di passeggeri e i piloti. Le indagini successive non portano a nulla, i sopravvissuti testimoniano solo un improvviso blackout e le registrazioni della scatola nera sono inutilizzabili. Il caso viene archiviato. Solo il professor Harold Holland, consulente del Pentagono, rimane scettico.

Un giorno ricevi una strana telefonata. Una certa signora White ti dice che la Foundation for Research and Study of the Extraordinary and Eccentric ha bisogno del tuo aiuto. A quanto pare il tuo nominativo è stato selezionato da un certo A.L.A.N.: vogliono che diventi un Agente del Destino e che li aiuti in un cosiddetto “Progetto di controllo dei Freak”. All’inizio ci hai riso su. Poi hai cominciato a pensarci.

Sono i fluorescenti anni Ottanta, e niente sarà mai più come prima.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Are the fluorescent eighties and the birth of the first TV musical, the boom in personal computers and hairstyles cotonate living with a climate of political tension. So when the British Airways flight 747, departed from London to Boston, disappears from radar during landing at Logan International Airport all think of a terrorist attack. Instead, after a little over a minute, the plane reappears out of control and crashes on the track. Impact killed thirty passengers and drivers. Further investigations lead nowhere, the only surviving witness a sudden blackout and the black box recordings are unusable. The case is closed. Only Professor Harold Holland, Pentagon consultant, remains skeptical.

One day you receive a strange phone call. A Mrs. White tells you that the Foundation for Research and Study of the Extraordinary and Eccentric needs your help. Apparently your name was selected from some ALAN: They want to become an Agent of Destiny and help them in a so-called "Project Control Freak". At first you did laugh about. Then you started to think about it.

They are the fluorescent eighties, and nothing will ever be the same again.

177238.name: Messico e Nuvole
177238.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spaghetti per il vostro Weird Western. Messico & Nuvole porta il Western all’Italiana in Deadlands. Qui dentro c’è tutto quello che vi serve.

Pistoleri straccioni, giustizieri armati di gatling, mezzosangue assetati di vendetta, desperados con una coscienza, pistolere sexy.
Esplosioni, sparatorie, risse colossali.
Deserti polverosi.
Città minacciate da orde di bandidos.
Piramidi azteche e dinosauri.
E fagioli.




Include la campagna completa, La Grande Guerra delle Ossa, e una serie di quattro scenari, Poker di Donne.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Spaghetti for your Weird Western. Mexico & Clouds brings the Western Italian style in Deadlands. In here there is everything you need.

Gunmen beggars, executioners armed with Gatling, half-blood-thirsty revenge, desperados with a conscience, pistolere sexy.
Explosions, shootings, fights colossal.
Dusty deserts.
City threatened by hordes of bandidos.
Aztec pyramids and dinosaurs.
And beans.




It includes the full campaign, The Great War of the Bones, and a set of four scenarios, Poker for Women.

177239.name: The Powers Companion
177239.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abilites Above and Beyond Those of Normal Characters!

Whether they are the abilties of monsters, demi-humans, aliens or even Super Heroes, it all comes down to Powers. Incredible strength, the gift of flight, super speed, or even frickin' Laser Beams and MORE!

This companion for the Victory System includes THREE HUNDRED Powers for your Victory System campaigns. Choose from the abilities of the powerful Brick, the rapid Speedster, the Transcendental or Enigmatic, or mix and match to make your own super powerful combinations! Make custom monsters, insidious aliens, or just make bad guys that will give the hardiest Player Characters pause!

Discover the secrets of Gadgeteering, create Characters with random sets of powers, find Equipment for enhancing the Heroic (or Villainous!), and dig into what it means to run a Super Hero style game in the Victory System!

177240.name: Was passt wohin?
177240.description:
A game box forms a board that consist of tree, meadow and a lake.
And there is 14 chips that have pictures of animals, plants and things that child must put on the right spot of the board.
When all chips has been placed on their right spot on the board, the game ends.

Version for older kids, is that every of a two players has 4 spots on tree for himself, and chips are face down. Each player draws one chip and puts it on its place. Whoever puts chips on its 4 spot of a tree wins the game.
Harder version of a game is that all chips that are not placed on a tree are returned back face down next to unused chips.

177241.description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German city of Willich. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.

Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
177241.name: Willich-Quiz

177242.name: Malek Gyre (Supers!)
177242.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space Supers is a line of cosmic supers characters pdfs for the SUPERS RED RPG.

Malek Gyre is a space cop gone bad. He was one of the best and brightest in the interstellar police force called the Ghostlight Centurions. But now - he's fallen from grace, gone rogue and is ready to cause trouble in your next SUPERS games.

177243.description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German composer Richard Wagner. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
177243.name: Wagner-Quiz

177244.name: Legend of Kay Anniversary HD Remaster
177244.description:
User Summary

Legend of Kay Anniversary is a remastered version of the original game with high-resolution textures, more detailed character models, modern rendering techniques, and surround sound. It has 25 different levels with over 15 enemy types and 3 different primary weapons with distinct combat styles.

177245.description:
For centuries, the factions have been at war. However, it wasn’t until recently that they discovered the ability to create a bomb so powerful as to destroy entire planets. But now the secret is out, and it’s a race to see which faction will crown themselves as the superior race.

Players will take turns flying (flicking) their space ships around space, collecting energy to power up space bombs and eradicate their enemies.

The goal of the game is to be the player with the most points at the end of the game proving that their alien species is the supreme race.
177245.name: Cosmic Kaboom

177246.description:
Trivia game with questions related to German citations. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
177246.name: Deutsche-Zitate-Quiz

177247.description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German town of Lüneburg. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.

Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
177247.name: Lüneburg-Quiz

177248.description:
Europe of the Dark Ages was a treacherous landscape of shifting alliances, warfare, and betrayal. Among the most feared peoples of this time were the Northmen, who came from the lands of Scandinavia to pillage and conquer, without warning and without mercy. In time, the Northmen established their own kingdoms across Europe, and came to dominate many more, gathering enormous wealth and establishing lucrative trade routes.

In Saga of the Northmen, you control a clan of mighty Northmen. Each round, you will use your influence cards to try to gain control of the seven major kingdoms of Europe. You will then maneuver the armies and fleets of the kingdoms that have fallen under your sway. Use your forces wisely, and the riches of Europe are yours for the taking. But beware, there are other clans who also seek plunder and coin. Only the richest and most notorious clan will prevail!
177248.name: Saga of the Northmen
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 002 – Legendary!
The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 68: Tuesday, September 20th

177249.description:
The world is again threatened with war! As the War Minister of your small nation, you have been tasked with confronting aggression by developing atomic bombs for your country. Your spies have stolen the needed technology, but you need to acquire the materials and personnel to get the job done before your rival nations do. Once someone has built 10 megatons of bombs, the final round will finish, and the player with the most bombs will win, their nation’s survival assured!

To do this, you will be playing cards representing the training and use of teams of laborers, scientists, and engineers to complete various plans, until you have assembled enough bombs to win!

Stand alone game based on the popular "Manhattan Project" board game by Minion Games, this is a simpler card-only game using dual-purpose cards in a quick and exciting race to completion.
177249.name: The Manhattan Project: Chain Reaction
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
1P 108 - Warhammer Quest: Adventure Card Game
Episode 35 - Games with Scalable Difficulty
Episode 3: The one about the ending of a partnership and women in gaming
HLG 3: Explosief Materiaal
OrcaCon and the Games of 2016

177251.description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German town of Göttingen. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
177251.name: Göttingen-Quiz

177253.description: Promo card for the game Dead Men Tell No Tales. This pirate can use anyone else's ability once per turn.
177253.name: Dead Men Tell No Tales: Camille E.N. Promo Card
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 48 - Dead Men Tell No Tales

177254.name: The Keep of the Lich Lord
177254.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Lord Mortis has risen!

Clawing his way back from the grave, the lich lord has set his sights on conquest of the mainland.

A cunning and fearless adventurer is needed for a vital mission to enter Bloorise Keep and overthrow Lord Mortis - an adventurer like YOU!

Dave Morris has re-written and expanded much of the original Fighting Fantasy version of this gamebook (Book 43: The Keep of the Lich-Lord) to fit the Fabled Lands World and System.

Includes an appendix of rejected pitches for Fighting Fantasy gamebooks.

177255.description:
The Mercenary Start Card Expansion includes one card/tile that may be used with all Spurs and Sprockets card/tile decks.

The Mercenary is placed in the field first and the start player places his/her card/tile adjacent to the Mercenary. Play continues based on which Spurs and Sprockets rules you have decided to play with. The Mercenary card/tile has lines in all directions and can be added to all players adjacent rows for scoring purposes. Although the Mercenary has a 0 on it and does not give any points to any player. The Mercenary may be destroyed by using Fired Away rules.
177255.name: Spurs and Sprockets: Mercenary

177256.name: EW-System Lite
177256.description:
User Summary

EW-System Lite is a republished light version EW-System rules, by Cassendre Experiment.

In French.

177257.name: EW-System Core Rules
177257.description:
User Summary

EW-System Core Rules is the version 2.0 of the EW-System rules.

It is published under OGL.

In French.

177259.description:
Originally distributed as Kickstarter extras, these two new specialists will be available (as a set) at conventions and the BGG store.

With the 8 specialists already included, this brings the total available to 10.

Postmaster: May contribute Metal(s) from any adjacent hex to the Temple.

Peddler: May return one less Basic Good of any type during a (-1) Market Trade.
177259.name: Ophir: Additional Specialists – Postmaster and Peddler

rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)
177260.name: The Imperial Archives
177260.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Imperial Archives collects a variety of material for the L5R 4th Edition RPG that we have been unable to fit into previous books.

From discussions of Shourido and the office of Shogun, to NPCs and Oni Lords, to a discussion of how to play Courtiers, this book has something for everyone!

New mechanics include the Susumu Courtiers, Scorpion maskmakers, and an extensive discussion of options for enhancing shugenja spellcasting. Also included is the official Errata for L5R 4th Edition.

177261.name: Underprepared Heist Management
177261.description:
Planning a bank heist is hard. Pulling off a heist without a plan is even harder...

You have an idea for an amazing heist. You know of a bank that is stocked with safe deposit boxes loaded with cash, and you have assembled a team of 13 faithful robbers to do the dirty work. As you settle down to craft the perfect plan for the heist, you find out that several other people are planning to hit the same bank. Naturally, you decide to throw caution to the wind and move forward with the heist, planning it as you go... What’s the worst that could happen?

Underprepared Heist Management is a fast-paced card game for 2-5 players. During the heist, players work with a limited pool of plans that they are dealt, managing their heist as best as they can by ordering their robbers to steal and terminate other robbers. Situations may arise that completely alter the flow of the heist in unexpected (and sometimes deadly) ways. After the heist, everyone tallies up their take, revealing the hidden contents of the safe deposit boxes they managed to grab during the heist. The manager with the highest haul is the winner!

177262.name: Za siedmioma górami!
177262.description:
Adventure game for kids set in fairy tale land where each player controls different character.

Modular board is build throughout the game while players explore different places. To move character players have to roll dice and match the color pattern on the leading ways. Meeting friends and rides helps to expend abilities and gives better chances to win fights and pass all kind of tests.

The goal is to find the enchanted princess, break the spell and bring her to the castle.

177263.name: Jet Gunner
177263.description:
User Summary

A 2D action platformer with an 8-Bit art style. Collect weapon power ups to change your gun or to acquire a small robot that follows you around and shoot with you. Use your jetpack to avoid enemies or to get around hazards. Six stages, each broken up into multiple areas with multiple boss fights, two difficulties, and challenge levels to complete.

177264.name: Ice Tomb of the Giant Queen
177264.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Following the trail of the Storm Tyrant’s armies, the heroes come to a frost giant village that serves as a training camp, led by a frost giant graveknight who issues orders from within an icy crypt. As the heroes engage in guerrilla tactics to weaken the army of giants and disband the training camp, they can ally with a red dragon who is attempting to infiltrate the giant camp for her own purposes. Once they’ve broken the ranks of the giants in the camp outside, the heroes venture into an icy crypt to defeat their undead leader, learning that the best graduates of the training camp are sent on to an elite military academy run by fire giants.

Ice Tomb of the Giant Queen is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 10th-level characters. The adventure continues the Giantslayer Adventure Path, a classic sword & sorcery campaign that pits the players against hordes of evil giants. Several new monsters, an overview of the most infamous graveknights to walk Golarion, an exploration of the giant organizations of the Inner Sea, and Clinton J. Boomer’s Pathfinder Journal round out this volume of the Pathfinder Adventure Path!

Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world’s oldest fantasy RPG.

177266.name: Anvil of Fire
177266.description:
publisher blurb

The heroes delve into a subterranean dungeon complex beneath the caldera of a dormant volcano in the Mindspin Mountains, where they must infiltrate the elite military academy that trains officers for the Storm Tyrant's giant army. If they can survive the giants, dragons, and extraplanar menaces that have assembled under the Storm Tyrant's banner, the heroes will have an even larger challenge before them—facing off against the fire giant general-king Tytarian before the Storm Tyrant sets out to conquer all of Avistan! This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path continues the Giantslayer Adventure Path and includes:


"Anvil of Fire," a Pathfinder adventure for 13th-level characters, by Sean K Reynolds.
A look into the faith and worship of the fire giant god Zursvaater, by Sean K Reynolds.
Advice and new options that allow you to harness the destructive power of volcanoes for your game, by Russ Taylor.
A case of poor judgment turned dangerous in the Pathfinder's Journal, by Wendy N. Wagner.
Five new monsters, by Benjamin Bruck, Mikko Kallio, David Schwartz, and Jerome Virnich.


Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world's oldest fantasy RPG.

177267.name: Shadow of the Storm Tyrant
177267.description:
Back of the Book:

The thrilling conclusion of the Giantslayer Adventure Path! Emerging from a Fire giant dungeon into a volcano's caldera, the heroes spy the Storm Tyrant's stolen cloud castle floating high above. From there, they must storm the stronghold as it takes off into the sky, engaging in bloody battle with the ruthless storm giant's elite guardians and allies.

Finally the heroes must face the Storm Tyrant himself. -- alongside his dominated red dragon -- to put an end to his megalomaniacal push for power. Will the heroes defeat Volstus the Storm Tyrant, or will of Avistan bend its knee to they mighty warlord and his giant armies?

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path concludes the Giantslayer Adventure Path and includes:


Shadow of the Storm Tyrant, a Pathfinder Adventure for 115th-level characters, by Tito Leati
High-stakes plots and dangerous foes to continue and expand your Giant Slayer campaign, by Jim Groves
A look at other extraplanar giants known as gigas, by Patrick Renie
A final tall tale of hunting giants in the Pathfinder's Journal, by Patrick Renie
Four new monstrous threats, by Benjamin Bruck, Steven T. Helt, Mikko Kallio, and Patrick Renie.

177268.name: Palette
177268.description: Palette features a deck of cards, each of which displays one of six colors and some which display the designation, goal card. Players are dealt a hand of cards and take turns playing one card and then replenishing. A goal card is played into one of four slots in a central area; the other cards are played into players' individual tableaux. Special cards also can be played that replace and otherwise manipulate the cards in the tableaux and central area. The winner is the first player to match the colors of the four cards in his tableau with those in the central area.

177269.name: Giantslayer Player's Guide
177269.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Giantslayer Player's Guide gives players all the spoiler-free information, inspiration, and new rules they'll need to create characters prepared for delving into the adventure and intrigue of the Giantslayer Adventure Path.

Within, players of this campaign will find everything they need to create character backgrounds tied to personalities and events vital to Pathfinder Adventure Path's exploration of some of the many ancient tombs and dangerous locations in the Mindspin Mountains, along with new campaign—specific traits to give bold adventurers the edge they'll need to take on the strange and deadly threats faced on their quest. This player’s guide also features a view of the town of Trunau where the adventure begins, as well as various class options and advice for heroes ready to dive into a Giantslayer campaign.

Adventurers don't need to set out unprepared! Gather your allies and let the Giantslayer Player's Guide start your trip into the thrill and danger of taking down some gigantic foes.

177270.name: In Hell's Bright Shadow
177270.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The city of Kintargo has long been a shelter for artists, free-thinkers, and those marginalized by the oppressive Chelaxian government, but now the city has been placed under martial law by inquisitor Barzilali Thrune. When a protest turns into a riot, a new group of heroes comes together to form an organized resistance to the devil-binding government and the Church of Asmodeus, but can they survive long enough to establish allies? Or will they become the latest victims of the Thrice-Damned House of Thrune?

In Hell’s Bright Shadow is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 1st-level characters. The adventure begins the Hell’s Rebels Adventure Path, an urban- and political-themed campaign that focuses on a rebellion against one of the Pathfinder Campaign Setting’s most infamous nations—devil-haunted Cheliax. Several new monsters, an extensive gazetteer of the city of Kintargo, and a brand new Pathfinder Journal round out this volume of the Pathfinder Adventure Path!

Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world’s oldest fantasy RPG.

177271.name: Turn of the Torrent
177271.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rebel group known as the Silver Ravens once fought for independence in the city of Kintargo, but after the nation’s civil war came to an end, they disbanded—until today! Now, new heroes have re-established the rebel group to stand against the inquisitor Barzillai Thrune and his oppressive diabolic regime. But before the Silver Ravens can rise up, they’ll need allies—friends among powerful groups like the Hellknights of the Torrent, Kintargo’s established rebel cults, and disenfranchised agents of the government itself. But until the heroes find the perfect hideout for their rebellion—a place secret enough and strong enough to withstand the battles to come—they’ll be forced to stay in the shadows. When a perfect site for their headquarters comes along, will the heroes survive long enough to claim it as their own?

Turn of the Torrent is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 4th-level characters. The adventure continues the Hell’s Rebels Adventure Path, an urban- and political-themed campaign that focuses on a rebellion against one of the Pathfinder Campaign Setting’s most infamous nations—devil-haunted Cheliax. Several new monsters, an exploration of the fishlike humanoids known as skum, and a brand new Pathfinder Journal round out this volume of the Pathfinder Adventure Path!

Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world’s oldest fantasy RPG.

177272.name: Feast of Dust
177272.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A deadly new curse known as the Carrion Call spreads rapidly through the Meraz Desert, driving its victims mad with hunger and a burning desire to flee into the sands. To find the source of this affliction, the heroes must challenge gnoll tribes, fiends, and the walking dead to discover the secret of a long-forgotten evil—the daemon lord known as The Vulture King. Once worshiped as a god, this vile creature threatens to spread his feast of dust to new lands unless someone can find the keys to stopping his unholy resurrection.

Designed for 11th-level characters!

Pathfinder Modules are 64-page, high-quality, full-color, adventures using the Open Game License to work with both the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and the standard 3.5 fantasy RPG rules set. This Pathfinder Module includes new monsters, treasure, a double-sided poster map, and a fully detailed bonus location that can be used as part of the adventure or in any other game!

177273.name: Shootout
177273.description: At the beginning of Shootout players receive an identity: sheriff, deputy, gunfighter, outlaw, etc. Initially, only the sheriff is known to the other players. Before each round, every player chooses a weapon and then all players simultaneously "shoot" other players by pointing at them. Shots can be deflected or dodged; players take wounds and get healed and take more wounds. Identities become easier to figure out. The sheriff and deputies win by killing the outlaws and vice versa.

177274.name: Down the Blighted Path
177274.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Into the Darkness!

Troubled times have come to the town of Macridi, as undead dwarves attack local festivals and abduct relatives of the fallen hero Lady Delbera Axebringer. The PCs are tasked with finding the source of these attacks and putting an end to it, a quest that takes them into the subterranean world of Nar-Voth, leads them on a mission to recover the axe Firebrand, and eventually carries them into the spires of the Court of Ether in an effort to end a necromancer's vengeance.

Down the Blighted Path is an adventure for 5th-level characters, and includes 64 pages of intense combat, daring exploration, and new threats. The author of this adventure, Monica Marlowe, was the winner of RPG Superstar 2015, in which hundreds of unpublished authors compete for the chance to write a Pathfinder Module, and in addition to her adventure, this book contains a host of new monsters and magic items designed by the contest's runners-up.

Players can expect to reach 7th level upon completion of this adventure—assuming they aren't killed by...

Pathfinder Modules are 64-page, high-quality, full-color, adventures using the Open Game License to work with both the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and the standard 3.5 fantasy RPG rules set. This Pathfinder Module includes new monsters, treasure, a double-sided poster map, and a fully detailed bonus location that can be used as part of the adventure or in any other game!

177275.name: Cohorts & Companions
177275.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Prepare for your adventures to get twice as exciting with Pathfinder Player Companion: Cohorts and Companions! Double the daring and fun with all-new rules for turning your adventurer into part of a dynamic duo. Whether you’re growing a towering treant to serve as your monstrous cohort or organizing a grand heist with your fellow thieves, Cohorts and Companions gives you the rules you need! New options allow you to make the most of your allies, or even make your allies from scratch! From binding outsiders to winning over artist patrons, this volume has cohorts ideal for any character concept.

Inside this book, you’ll find:


Character options to help class abilities benefit from a cohort’s assistance, from bardic harmonies to ally-oriented rogue talents.
Multiple new ways to gain and use cohorts, including using magical beasts to serve as animal companions, conscripting teams of low-level recruits, and using magic items as cohorts.
New archetypes that allow characters to focus on their cohorts, such as the esquire for cavaliers, construct rider for alchemists, and instructor for wizards.
Tables arranged by theme listing dozens of new monster cohorts of many different creature types, along with their effective cohort levels.
New campaign-focused rules allowing you to secretly recruit teams of criminals during downtime, win the love of enthusiasts of the arts, and arrange for contingency services!


This Pathfinder Player Companion is intended for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and the Pathfinder campaign setting, but can easily be incorporated into any fantasy world.

177276.name: Monster Summoner's Handbook
177276.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Call upon otherworldly powers and summon beings from beyond with Pathfinder Player Companion: Monster Summoner’s Handbook! Featuring dozens of new feats, magic items, archetypes, and character options designed to grant you control over fantastic beasts or enhance your summoning prowess, this player-friendly volume contains everything you need to transform your adventurer into a herald of forces benign or malevolent, divine or alien. Call upon never-before-seen creatures and claim all the tools you need to make yourself a true master of monsters.

177277.name: Dirty Tactics Toolbox
177277.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Make sure you never get stuck in a fair fight again with Pathfinder Player Companion: Dirty Tactics Toolbox. Learn how to use poisons, dirty trick maneuvers, sneak attacks, ambushes, and hidden equipment to more than even the odds in any encounter. This player-focused volume contains dozens of new feats, magic items, spells, and other character options to let you have a nasty trick or two up your sleeve, or become the unquestioned master of fighting dirty.

177278.name: Heroes of the Streets
177278.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From the well-traveled avenues of Absalom to the outcast city of Kaer Maga, the streets of Golarion are full of danger, intrigue, and, of course, adventurers! Learn the laws of the street, work your way into a thieves’ guild, and gain the support of the masses with Pathfinder Player Companion: Heroes of the Streets! Featuring dozens of all-new rules for urban characters like feats, spells, magic items, and more, Heroes of the Streets contains everything Pathfinder RPG players need to make their characters masters of vast markets, back alleys, and everywhere the city takes them.

177279.name: Occult Origins
177279.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Unlock your inner potential with Pathfinder Player Companion: Occult Origins! Featuring brand new rules and options for the 6 new occult character classes from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Occult Adventures hardcover, this volume outlines ways to fit psychic characters into the Pathfinder campaign setting. Discover secrets of the mind from across the Pathfinder world, including archetypes tied to secret traditions, new occult rituals, psychic spells, magic items, and much more!

177280.name: Key to the Front Door
177280.description: Key to the Front Door is an educational game aimed primarily at school children to help teach money management. Players take turns rolling dice and moving around a board in Monopoly fashion. The board spaces allow players to purchase "needs" or "wants", to add funds to savings, to splurge on a vacation, to buy or sell at garage sales, or to spend or earn money in a variety of other ways. The winner is either the first player to furnish his apartment with all his "needs" or the last player to go broke.

177281.name: Monster Codex Box
177281.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The humanoid legions of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Monster Codex swarm across your tabletop in this massive collection of more than 300 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying game or any fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn contains a beautiful full-color monster image and slides into a size-appropriate plastic base. Featured creatures include goblins, orcs, hobgoblins, bugbears, boggards, kobolds, ghouls, sahuagin, trolls, troglodytes, gnolls, lizardfolk, duergar, ratfolk, fire giants, frost giants, ogres, drow, serpentfolk, and vampires! With multiple pawns for commonly encountered creatures and nearly 250 distinct creature images, the Monster Codex Box has exactly what you need to bring the game’s most popular monsters to life!

177282.name: Summon Monster Pawn Collection
177282.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Summon legions of extraplanar creatures to your tabletop with this collection of more than 100 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy roleplaying game! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn contains a beautiful full-color image of a monster from the summon monster spell lists in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder Pawns Bestiary Box, making them easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With multiple pawns for commonly summoned creatures, the Summon Monster Pawn Collection is the best way to ensure you’ve got the perfect monsters to conjure for every Pathfinder Roleplaying Game encounter!

Legions of summoned extraplanar creatures come to life on your tabletop! Each pawn has its own abbreviation and identification number for easy sorting. The Summon Monster Pawn Collection includes:

Small (and Smaller)
Archon, Lantern (4)
Demon, Dretch (2)
